short_summary: Green Gables Golf Course Retaining Wall Replacement
description: The existing Green Gables Golf course has two underpasses for golfers accessing the north side of Route 6. The existing retaining wall should not be preserved due to a lifespan nearing completion and upon inspection by an engineer deemed no longer eligible for maintenance. The contractor shall replace these retaining walls. The design requirements must be opened in July 2nd after the Inspection which will be hosted by Parks Canada.
full_summary:
**Tender Notice: Green Gables Golf Course Retaining Wall Replacement**

**Project Overview**

Parks Canada invites bids from qualified contractors to replace the existing retaining wall at Green Gables Golf Course in Cavendish, Prince Edward Island. The current wall system is nearing the end of its life cycle and has been deemed suitable for replacement to ensure public safety.

**Project Scope**

The project involves the removal of the existing retaining wall and the installation of a new wall system to provide stable and safe access to the golf course. The new wall system will be designed to meet the National Parks Regulations and will be constructed according to the specifications outlined in the bid documents.

**Key Dates**

* Tender Closing Date: August 25, 2022, 1:00 PM AST (13:00)
* Site Visit: August 15, 2022, 9:00 AM AST (09:00)
* Project Completion Date: December 31, 2022

**Submission Requirements**

Bids must be submitted electronically via email to [soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca). The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes. It is the bidder's responsibility to ensure that their submission is received by the deadline.

**Safety Requirements**

All persons attending the site visit must wear the required personal protective equipment (safety glasses, footwear, vests, and hard hats). Bidders must communicate with the Contracting Authority by August 12, 2022, to confirm attendance and provide the names of the persons attending.

**Contact Information**

For technical and contractual inquiries, please contact Christine Piche, Contracting Authority, at [Christine.piche@pc.gc.ca](mailto:Christine.piche@pc.gc.ca) or 873-355-8841.

**Attachments**

Bid documents and specifications are available on the Government of Canada's tendering service website at [www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders). 

**Closing Notes**

Parks Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Late submissions will not be considered. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. If you find any discrepancies between the English and French documents, please notify the Contracting Authority as soon as possible.
